steps.title: Navigate to the desktop and press the Windows + X keys.
steps.content: Navigate to the desktop and press the Windows + X keys. This will open the Power User Task menu. If you're using an older version of Windows, jump to instructions for Windows 7, Vista , and Windows XP ,

steps.title: Click on “Network Connections,” then select either “Ethernet” or “Wi-Fi,” based on your Internet connection type.
steps.content: Click on “Network Connections,” then select either “Ethernet” or “Wi-Fi,” based on your Internet connection type. This will open the network connection status window.

steps.title: Click on “Properties,” then select “Internet Protocol Version 4.
steps.content: Click on “Properties,” then select “Internet Protocol Version 4. ”

steps.title: Click on “Properties,” then place checkmarks next to “Obtain an IP address automatically” and “Obtain DNS server address automatically.
steps.content: Click on “Properties,” then place checkmarks next to “Obtain an IP address automatically” and “Obtain DNS server address automatically. ”

steps.title: Click on “OK,” then close the network connection status window.
steps.content: Click on “OK,” then close the network connection status window. DHCP will now be enabled on your Windows 10 or Windows 8 computer. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the Apple menu and select “System Preferences.
steps.content: Click on the Apple menu and select “System Preferences. ” This will open the System Preferences menu.

steps.title: Click on “Network,” then select your Internet connection type from the left pane.
steps.content: Click on “Network,” then select your Internet connection type from the left pane. For example, if using an Ethernet Internet connection, select “Ethernet.”

steps.title: Click on the dropdown menu next to “Configure IPv4” and select “Using DHCP.
steps.content: Click on the dropdown menu next to “Configure IPv4” and select “Using DHCP. ”

steps.title: Click on “Apply,” then close the System Preferences window.
steps.content: Click on “Apply,” then close the System Preferences window. DHCP will now be enabled.

steps.title: Click on the Start menu and select “Control Panel.
steps.content: Click on the Start menu and select “Control Panel. ” This will open the Control Panel menu.

steps.title: Click on “Network and Sharing Center,” then click on “Local Area Connection” under “View your active networks.
steps.content: Click on “Network and Sharing Center,” then click on “Local Area Connection” under “View your active networks. ” This will open the Local Area Connection Status window.

steps.title: Click on “Properties,” then select “Internet Protocol Version 4.
steps.content: Click on “Properties,” then select “Internet Protocol Version 4. ”

steps.title: Click on “Properties,” then place checkmarks next to “Obtain an IP address automatically” and “Obtain DNS server address automatically.
steps.content: Click on “Properties,” then place checkmarks next to “Obtain an IP address automatically” and “Obtain DNS server address automatically. ”

steps.title: Click on “OK,” then close the network connection status window.
steps.content: Click on “OK,” then close the network connection status window. DHCP will now be enabled on your Windows 7 or Windows Vista computer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the Start menu and select “Control Panel.
steps.content: Click on the Start menu and select “Control Panel. ” This will open the Control Panel menu.

steps.title: Double-click on “Network Connections,” or “Network and Internet Connections.
steps.content: Double-click on “Network Connections,” or “Network and Internet Connections. ”

steps.title: Right-click on “Local Area Connection,” then click on “Properties.
steps.content: Right-click on “Local Area Connection,” then click on “Properties. ”

steps.title: Click on “Internet Protocol (TCP/IP),” then click on “Properties.
steps.content: Click on “Internet Protocol (TCP/IP),” then click on “Properties. ”

steps.title: Place checkmarks next to “Obtain an IP address automatically” and “Obtain DNS server address automatically.
steps.content: Place checkmarks next to “Obtain an IP address automatically” and “Obtain DNS server address automatically. ”

steps.title: Click on “OK.
steps.content: Click on “OK. ” DHCP will now be enabled.
